description.narrative: (Uganda): The objective of MAPD is to strengthen the capacity of the Ministry of Health's National Malaria Control Division and District Health Management Teams, by implementing a package of high-impact malaria interventions that focus on community prevention. These interventions include the use of long lasting insecticide treated bed nets, prevention of malaria during pregnancy, strengthening of diagnostics and treatment of malaria, strengthening surveillance, and reporting. These interventions aim to decrease malaria morbidity and mortality in 52 (central, midwest, and west-Nile) target districts.The activity protects approximately 13 million people from the effects of malaria and will receive an allocation of $4,265,189 in FY 2020 funds. ...
